lessons.title: Dzimbahwe - Great Zimbabwe
lessons.description: Learn about the magnificent stone city that gave Zimbabwe its name
learningObjectives: Understand the significance of Great Zimbabwe in African history
Learn vocabulary related to ancient architecture and civilization
Explore the Shona Kingdom's golden age (1100-1450 CE)
Discover how Great Zimbabwe influenced modern Zimbabwe's identity
discoveryElements: Explore the meaning of 'dzimba dza mabwe' (houses of stone)
Discover the Zimbabwe Bird symbol and its cultural significance
Learn about ancient trade routes with China, Persia, and Arabia
Understand the architectural genius of stone construction without mortar
culturalNotes: Great Zimbabwe is the largest ancient structure south of the Sahara
The name Zimbabwe means 'house of stone' in Shona
The Zimbabwe Bird appears on the national flag and currency
UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1986

vocabulary.usage: The name of our great nation
Plural form referring to stone structures

lessons.title: Madzishe neVaMambo - Chiefs and Kings
lessons.description: Learn about the great rulers of pre-colonial Zimbabwe
learningObjectives: Learn about the Mutapa Empire and its influence
Understand the Rozvi Empire under Changamire Dombo
Discover the role of spirit mediums (svikiro) in governance
Master vocabulary related to traditional leadership
discoveryElements: Explore the gold trade that made these kingdoms wealthy
Learn about Mwene Mutapa's diplomatic relations with Portugal
Discover how oral history preserved our heritage
Understand the sacred relationship between rulers and ancestors
culturalNotes: The Mutapa Empire controlled much of present-day Zimbabwe from 1450-1629
Changamire Dombo defeated the Portuguese in 1684
Spirit mediums (masvikiro) connected rulers to ancestral wisdom
Traditional leaders still play important roles in modern Zimbabwe

vocabulary.usage: Title of the great empire rulers
Title given to great military leaders
Precious metal traded by ancient kingdoms
The domain or period of a king's rule

lessons.title: Mbuya Nehanda naKaguvi - Heroes of Resistance
lessons.description: Learn about the First Chimurenga and Zimbabwe's resistance heroes
learningObjectives: Understand the First Chimurenga (1896-1897) resistance war
Learn about Mbuya Nehanda and Sekuru Kaguvi's leadership
Explore the spiritual dimension of the liberation struggle
Master vocabulary related to resistance and freedom
discoveryElements: Discover Mbuya Nehanda's prophetic words: 'My bones will rise again'
Learn how spirit mediums united different Shona groups
Explore the role of traditional religion in resistance
Understand the connection between First and Second Chimurenga
culturalNotes: Mbuya Nehanda was executed in 1898 but her spirit inspired future generations
Kaguvi was a powerful spirit medium of the Zezuru people
The First Chimurenga united Shona and Ndebele against colonialism
Nehanda's prophecy came true with independence in 1980

lessons.title: Hondo Yechipiri - The Second Chimurenga
lessons.description: Learn about Zimbabwe's war of liberation (1966-1979)
learningObjectives: Understand the Second Chimurenga liberation war
Learn about ZANU and ZAPU liberation movements
Explore the role of neighboring countries in the struggle
Master vocabulary related to modern liberation history
discoveryElements: Discover how the war began in Chinhoyi in 1966
Learn about liberation war camps in Mozambique and Zambia
Explore the role of women in the liberation struggle
Understand the Lancaster House negotiations
culturalNotes: The liberation war lasted 13 years from 1966 to 1979
Many young people left school to join the struggle
The war ended with negotiations at Lancaster House in London
Independence was achieved on April 18, 1980

vocabulary.usage: Term of respect for liberation fighters

lessons.title: Zimbabwe Yatsva - Independent Zimbabwe
lessons.description: Learn about Zimbabwe's independence and modern history
learningObjectives: Understand Zimbabwe's independence celebrations in 1980
Learn about nation-building efforts and reconciliation
Explore Zimbabwe's role in Southern African development
Master vocabulary related to modern Zimbabwe
discoveryElements: Discover the significance of April 18, 1980
Learn about the new flag and national symbols
Explore education and health care expansion after independence
Understand Zimbabwe's contributions to regional peace
culturalNotes: Bob Marley performed at the independence celebrations
Zimbabwe's literacy rate became one of the highest in Africa
The country adopted a policy of reconciliation
Zimbabwe has 16 official languages including Shona and Ndebele

lessons.title: Tsika Nemagariro - Culture and Heritage
lessons.description: Explore Zimbabwe's rich cultural heritage and traditions
learningObjectives: Learn about Zimbabwe's diverse ethnic groups and languages
Understand traditional music, dance, and art forms
Explore important cultural sites and monuments
Master vocabulary related to cultural heritage
discoveryElements: Discover the mbira music tradition and its spiritual significance
Learn about traditional dances like jerusarema and muchongoyo
Explore stone sculpture and basket weaving traditions
Understand the role of totems (mitupo) in Shona society
culturalNotes: Zimbabwe has over 250 stone sculpture artists internationally recognized
The mbira has been played for over 1000 years
Totems connect people to nature and regulate marriages
Traditional pottery and basket weaving are UNESCO recognized

vocabulary.usage: Ancestral ceremony with music and dance
